dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3912 IH: Bob von Schwedler Permanent Health Coverage Tax Credit Expansion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kildee (for himself, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Slotkin, Ms. Sewell, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, and Mr. Evans) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make the health coverage tax credit permanent.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bob von Schwedler Permanent Health Coverage Tax Credit Expansion Act.

section.header: Permanent credit for health insurance costs

subsection.text: Section 35(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term eligible coverage month means any month if, as of the first day of such month, the taxpayer—

subparagraph.text: is covered by qualified health insurance, the premium for which is paid by the taxpayer,
does not have other specified coverage, and
is not imprisoned under Federal, State, or local authority.

subsection.text: Section 35(a) of such Code is amended by striking 72.5 percent and inserting 80 percent.

paragraph.text: Section 35(e)(2)(B)(i) of such Code is amended by striking clauses (iii) and (iv) of subsection (b)(1)(A) and inserting subparagraphs (C) and (D) of subsection (b)(1).
Subsections (b) and (e)(1) of section 7527 of such Code are each amended by striking 72.5 percent and inserting 80 percent.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to coverage months beginning after December 31, 2021.

Notwithstanding section 35(g)(11)(B)(i) of such Code, an election to apply section 35 of such Code to an eligible coverage month (as defined in section 35(b) of such Code) beginning after December 31, 2021, and before the beginning of the first taxable year beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act—

subparagraph.text: may be made at any time on or after such date of enactment and before the later of—

clause.text: the expiration of the 3-year period of limitation prescribed in section 6511(a) of such Code with respect to the taxable year for such coverage month, or
any date specified in guidance issued by the Secretary, and

subparagraph.text: may be made on an amended return.
